  3. Sgor na h-Ulaidh

Sgor na h-Ulaidh

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

The forgotten mountain of Glen Coe, Sgor na h-Ulaidh is hidden from view and sees far fewer ascents than other peaks in the glen. It is exceptionally steep but the view is an unfamiliar aspect to the better known peaks around it.

 You have not climbed Sgor na h-Ulaidh.

Region: Fort William

Altitude: 994 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.57/5
Rating: 3.6/5 (53 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Sgor na h-Ulaidh and Meall Ligiche from Glen Coe

Other routes and challenges

Meall Lighiche can be omitted from the route above by continuing up the glen before heading for the Bealach Easan.

An alternative ascent can be made from Glen Etive. Follow forestry tracks from Invercharnan into the upper glen above the Allt nan Gaoirean. From here you can either ascend Meall a' Bhuiridh, or head for the bealach between it and Sgurr na h-Ulaidh.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Glencoe Hotels

Glencoe B&B

Glencoe Cottages

Lochaber Hostels
